creator: makly
description: This is the main file that demonstrates the layout of JSON file

easy.hint: A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a level surface for eating, writing, or working at.
A separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs.
A long upholstered seat with a back and arms, for two or more people.
A piece of furniture for sleep or rest, typically a framework with a mattress.
A large, tall cupboard or recess in which clothes may be hung or stored.
A flat-topped piece of furniture with cupboards and drawers, used for storing crockery, glasses, and table linen.

medium.hint: A shelf for holding books.
A table at which meals are served.
A low table, typically placed in front of a sofa.
A table with a mirror and drawers, used while dressing or applying makeup.
A seat without a back or arms, typically resting on three or four legs or on a single pedestal.
A long seat for several people, typically made of wood or stone.

hard.hint: A comfortable chair with side supports for a person's arms.
A low upholstered seat, or footstool, without a back or arms that typically serves also as a box, with the seat hinged to form a lid.
A long chair for reclining, with a back and a single armrest.
A mattress, originally Japanese, that can be rolled up or folded and put in a closet.
A chair mounted on rockers or springs, so as to rock to and fro.
A chair that folds up for easy storage.

easy.hint: A portable electronic device for making telephone calls.
A small, portable personal computer.
A portable computer that uses a touchscreen as its primary input device.
A device for recording visual images in the form of photographs, film, or video signals.
A pair of small loudspeaker drivers worn on or around the head over a user's ears.
A wearable computing device that closely resembles a wristwatch or other time-keeping device.

medium.hint: A machine for printing text or pictures onto paper.
A device that forwards data packets between computer networks.
An output device that displays information in pictorial form.
A panel of keys that operate a computer or typewriter.
A hand-held pointing device that detects two-dimensional motion relative to a surface.
A device that converts electrical signals into sound.

hard.hint: An optical device that projects an image onto a surface.
A device that scans documents and converts them into digital data.
An instrument for converting sound waves into electrical energy variations.
An unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) that can be remotely controlled or fly autonomously.
A head-mounted device that provides virtual reality for the wearer.
A device that outputs a video signal or visual image to display a video game.

easy.hint: A utensil consisting of a small, shallow bowl on a handle, used for eating, stirring, and serving food.
A utensil with two or more prongs, used for lifting food to the mouth or holding it when cutting.
A utensil with a blade and handle, used for cutting or as a weapon.
A flat dish, typically circular and made of china, from which food is eaten or served.
A small bowl-shaped container for drinking from, typically having a handle.
A round, deep dish or basin used for food or liquid.

medium.hint: An electric mixing machine used in food preparation for liquefying, chopping, or pureeing.
An electrical device for making toast.
An electric oven that heats and cooks food by exposing it to electromagnetic radiation.
A container or device in which water is boiled, having a lid, spout, and handle.
An enclosed compartment, usually part of a cooker, for cooking and heating food.
A large container that uses electricity to keep food cold.

hard.hint: A machine for washing dishes automatically.
An electric kitchen appliance used for chopping, mixing, or pureeing foods.
A pot that cooks food quickly under steam pressure.
An electric cooking pot that cooks food at a low temperature over a long period.
A stationary electric mixer for mixing ingredients.
A kitchen appliance that cooks by circulating hot air around the food.

easy.hint: A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine or electric motor.
A two-wheeled vehicle that is powered by pedaling.
A large motor vehicle carrying passengers by road, typically one serving the public on a fixed route and for a fare.
A motor vehicle designed to transport cargo.
A two-wheeled vehicle that is powered by a motor and has a step-through frame.
A medium-sized motor vehicle with a boxy shape and high roof, used for transporting goods or passengers.

medium.hint: A two-wheeled motor vehicle that is powered by an engine.
A powerful motor vehicle with large rear wheels, used chiefly on farms for hauling equipment and trailers.
A vehicle equipped for taking sick or injured people to and from the hospital.
A vehicle equipped for firefighting.
A vehicle used by police officers for transportation.
A small van, typically one fitted with seats for passengers.

hard.hint: A powerful track-laying tractor with caterpillar tracks and a broad curved upright blade at the front for clearing ground.
A large machine for digging and moving earth.
A vehicle with a pronged device in front for lifting and carrying heavy loads.
A machine with a revolving drum used for mixing cement with sand, gravel, and water to produce concrete.
A vehicle or device for removing snow from roads or railways.
A truck specially designed to collect municipal solid waste and transport it to a solid waste treatment facility.

easy.hint: A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractile claws.
A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, and a barking, howling, or whining voice.
A fully grown female animal of a domesticated breed of ox, kept to produce milk or beef.
A domesticated ruminant animal with a thick woolly coat and (typically only in the male) curving horns.
A large plant-eating domesticated mammal with solid hoofs and a flowing mane and tail, used for riding, racing, and to carry and pull loads.
An omnivorous domesticated hoofed mammal with sparse bristly hair and a flat snout for rooting in the soil.

medium.hint: A large herbivorous mammal with a trunk, long curved ivory tusks, and large ears, native to Africa and southern Asia.
A large African mammal with a very long neck and forelegs, having a coat patterned with brown patches separated by lighter lines.
A large plant-eating marsupial with a long powerful tail and strongly developed hind limbs that enable it to travel by leaping.
A large bearlike mammal with characteristic black-and-white markings, native to certain mountain forests in China.
An African wild horse with black-and-white stripes and an erect mane.
A large tawny-colored cat that lives in prides, found in Africa and northwestern India.

hard.hint: A small, aquatic, egg-laying mammal with a broad, flat tail, webbed feet, and a snout resembling a duck's bill.
A small Arctic whale, the male of which has a long forward-pointing spirally twisted tusk developed from one of its teeth.
A Mexican salamander that retains its larval features throughout its life.
A nocturnal burrowing mammal with long ears, a tubular snout, and a long extensible tongue, feeding on ants and termites.
A small wallaby with a short tail and a friendly appearance, native to some small islands off the coast of Western Australia.
A large browsing mammal of the giraffe family that lives in the rainforests of the Congo.
